article:
In the military science of ballistics, 'circular error probable (CEP)' (also
'circular error probability' or 'circle of equal probability' http://web.archive.org/web/20110720122829/http://www.naval-
technology.com/projects/vanguard/ ) is an intuitive measure of a weapon
system's precision. It is defined as the radius of a circle, centered about the
mean, whose boundary is expected to include the landing points of 50% of the
rounds. Circular Error Probable (CEP), Air Force Operational Test and
Evaluation Center Technical Paper 6, Ver 2, July 1987, p. 1
headings: Conversion between CEP, RMS, 2DRMS, and R95
